content:
Diagnosis
	1. High grade serous ovarian carcinoma, stage IIIC
	   Initially diagnosed September 2021
	   BRCA1 mutation positive
	   Currently on 4th line therapy

	2. Previous right breast cancer - 2015
	   Grade 2 invasive ductal carcinoma, T1N0M0
	   Disease free after mastectomy and tamoxifen

	3. Previous melanoma right calf - 2018
	   Stage IB, now disease free

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	09/2021 Primary debulking surgery - total abdominal hysterectomy, bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy, omentectomy
	03/2022 Secondary debulking for isolated pelvic recurrence

	Chemotherapy
	10/2021 - 03/2022 Carboplatin/Paclitaxel first line
	05/2022 - 08/2022 Carboplatin/Gemcitabine second line
	09/2022 - 12/2022 Olaparib maintenance
	01/2023 - 04/2023 Weekly Paclitaxel third line
	05/2023 - present Caelyx fourth line

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with new peritoneal and hepatic metastases

	Current issues
	Ascites requiring drainage
Fatigue
Poor appetite
Neuropathy

	Summary of consultation
	I reviewed [redacted name] today who attended with her daughter. Unfortunately, her most recent CT scan from 15/05/2024 shows clear evidence of disease progression with new peritoneal deposits and the development of three new liver metastases, the largest measuring 3.2cm. Her CA125 has risen from 450 to 1200 over the past six weeks. She has required three therapeutic paracenteses for symptomatic ascites since our last review.

Her performance status has declined to ECOG 3, spending most of the day resting due to fatigue. She has ongoing grade 2 palmar-plantar erythrodysesthesia from Caelyx and grade 2 peripheral neuropathy from previous taxane therapy. Her appetite has significantly decreased with early satiety, though she denies nausea. Weight has dropped by 4kg since last review.

Given the clear evidence of disease progression and declining performance status, we have had a detailed discussion about moving to best supportive care. [redacted name] and her family understand the situation but would like to explore the option of further systemic therapy. We have discussed the very low likelihood of response to fifth-line treatment and the risks of further deterioration.

	Further investigations
	Urgent CT guided drainage of ascites
Liver function tests and clotting

	Medication prescribed
	Dexamethasone 4mg daily
Increased Oxycontin to 40mg BD

	Follow up
	Urgent referral to palliative care team
Review in one week with blood results

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor renal function
Consider community palliative care referral

cancer_timeline.value: Primary debulking surgery - total abdominal hysterectomy, bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy, omentectomy
Secondary debulking for isolated pelvic recurrence
CA125 risen from 450 to 1200 over six weeks
CT shows new peritoneal deposits and three new liver metastases, largest 3.2cm

other_cancers.latest_situation: Disease free after mastectomy and tamoxifen

patient_facts.value: ECOG 3, spending most of the day resting due to fatigue
Symptomatic ascites requiring repeated therapeutic paracentesis
Early satiety and poor appetite with 4kg weight loss

status_updates.value: Advanced ovarian cancer showing disease progression on fourth-line therapy with declining performance status
Progressive disease with new peritoneal and hepatic metastases
Discussion regarding transition to best supportive care, patient wishes to explore further systemic therapy options
Declined to ECOG 3 with significant fatigue and weight loss
Urgent CT guided drainage of ascites, liver function tests and clotting
Urgent referral to palliative care team, review in one week with blood results
